clusters.title: Thailand and Cambodia Sign New Ceasefire Agreement
clusters.neutral_headline: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia Sign New Ceasefire Agreement
items.standfirst: The two nations will observe a 72-hour period of peace before engaging on key points in the deal.
items.content: The two nations will observe a 72-hour period of peace before engaging on key points in the deal.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire agreement to end fighting over border disputes
items.standfirst: The agreement was signed by the countries' defense ministers, Cambodia's Tea Seiha and Thailand's Nattaphon Narkphanit, at a border checkpoint. It declares that the sides are committed to an earlier ceasefire that ended five days of fighting in July and follow-up agreements.
items.content: The agreement was signed by the countries' defense ministers, Cambodia's Tea Seiha and Thailand's Nattaphon Narkphanit, at a border checkpoint. It declares that the sides are committed to an earlier ceasefire that ended five days of fighting in July and follow-up agreements.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire deal after weeks of fighting
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia signed a ceasefire agreement on Saturday after weeks of deadly fighting along their border.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia signed a ceasefire agreement on Saturday after weeks of deadly fighting along their border.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign a new ceasefire agreement to end border fighting
Thailand and Cambodia agree to ceasefire
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia agreed to an "immediate" ceasefire on Saturday (December 26), the two countries said in a joint statement, pledging to end border clashes that killed dozens of people.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia agreed to an "immediate" ceasefire on Saturday (December 26), the two countries said in a joint statement, pledging to end border clashes that killed dozens of people.

items.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire begins after weeks of deadly clashes
items.standfirst: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.
items.content: Almost one million people were displaced when hostilities resumed earlier this month after the first truce broke.

items.title: Thailand-Cambodia ceasefire starts, first 72 hours seen as critical test
items.standfirst: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect after weeks of deadly fighting across the border.
items.content: A ceasefire between Thailand and Cambodia has come into effect after weeks of deadly fighting across the border.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of deadly border clashes
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia on Saturday (December 27) signed a ceasefire agreement after three weeks of fighting that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than a million. FRANCE 24 correspondent, Tommy Walker, tells us more.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia on Saturday (December 27) signed a ceasefire agreement after three weeks of fighting that killed at least 47 people and displaced more than a million. FRANCE 24 correspondent, Tommy Walker, tells us more.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign new ceasefire agreement to end border fighting
items.standfirst: In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.
items.content: In addition to ending fighting, the agreement calls for no further military movements by either side and no violations of either side's airspace for military purposes.(Image credit: AP)

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of intense fighting
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia have signed a ceasefire agreement to end weeks of armed combat along their border over competing claims to territory.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia have signed a ceasefire agreement to end weeks of armed combat along their border over competing claims to territory.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia sign ceasefire agreement after weeks of deadly border clashes
items.standfirst: Thailand and Cambodia on Saturday signed a ceasefire agreement after three weeks of fighting killed at least 101 people and displaced more than a million. The truce comes after three days of talks, and it applies to "all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures", according to a statement signed by the two countries' defence ministers.
items.content: Thailand and Cambodia on Saturday signed a ceasefire agreement after three weeks of fighting killed at least 101 people and displaced more than a million. The truce comes after three days of talks, and it applies to "all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures", according to a statement signed by the two countries' defence ministers.

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree ‘immediate’ ceasefire after weeks of deadly border clashes
items.standfirst: Two countries pledge in joint statement to halt all forms of attacks and further troop deployments in long-running dispute over contested territoryThailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate” ceasefire, pledging to end weeks of deadly border clashes that have killed more than 100 people and displaced more than half a million on both sides.In a joint statement, the two south-east Asian neighbours said the ceasefire would take effect on Saturday at noon local time and involve “all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures, and military objectives of either side, in all cases and all areas”. Continue reading...
items.content: Two countries pledge in joint statement to halt all forms of attacks and further troop deployments in long-running dispute over contested territoryThailand and Cambodia have agreed to an “immediate” ceasefire, pledging to end weeks of deadly border clashes that have killed more than 100 people and displaced more than half a million on both sides.In a joint statement, the two south-east Asian neighbours said the ceasefire would take effect on Saturday at noon local time and involve “all types of weapons, including attacks on civilians, civilian objects and infrastructures, and military objectives of either side, in all cases and all areas”. Continue reading...

items.title: Thailand and Cambodia agree on ceasefire to end weeks of deadly fighting
items.standfirst: Agreement follows talks aimed at ending weeks of deadly clashes along the Thailand-Cambodia border.
items.content: Agreement follows talks aimed at ending weeks of deadly clashes along the Thailand-Cambodia border.

items.title: Cambodia accuses Thailand of launching strikes during border peace talks
items.standfirst: Thai reports claim Cambodia carried out overnight attacks ahead of officials from both countries meeting for a third day of negotiations on FridayCambodia has accused Thailand of intensifying its bombardment of disputed border areas, even as officials from the two countries attend a multi-day meeting aimed at negotiating an end to deadly clashes.The neighbours’ longstanding border conflict reignited this month, shattering an earlier truce and killing more than 40 people, according to official counts. About a million people have also been displaced. Continue reading...
items.content: Thai reports claim Cambodia carried out overnight attacks ahead of officials from both countries meeting for a third day of negotiations on FridayCambodia has accused Thailand of intensifying its bombardment of disputed border areas, even as officials from the two countries attend a multi-day meeting aimed at negotiating an end to deadly clashes.The neighbours’ longstanding border conflict reignited this month, shattering an earlier truce and killing more than 40 people, according to official counts. About a million people have also been displaced. Continue reading...

items.title: 12/27: Saturday Morning
items.standfirst: Major storms across the U.S. are threatening holiday travel. Meanwhile, President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are set to meet.
items.content: Major storms across the U.S. are threatening holiday travel. Meanwhile, President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are set to meet.

items.title: Zelenskyy to hold talks with European leaders amid fresh strikes on Kyiv
items.standfirst: Attacks leave hundreds of thousands in city without heating as Ukrainian leader prepares for flurry of weekend diplomacyA third of Kyiv is without heating after a Russian drone and missile barrage on the Ukrainian capital cut off power supplies, leaving hundreds of thousands of people facing freezing temperatures.Ukraine’s president, Volodymyr Zelenskyy, said Moscow had used nearly 500 drones and 40 missiles, including ballistic missiles, in the overnight attack. “The primary target is Kyiv – energy facilities and civilian infrastructure,” he said in a post on X. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Russia targets Kyiv with deadly strikes ahead of Trump-Zelenskyy meeting
items.standfirst: Explosions boomed across Kyiv for hours as ballistic missiles and drones hit the city in an attack that began early in the morning.
items.content: Explosions boomed across Kyiv for hours as ballistic missiles and drones hit the city in an attack that began early in the morning.

items.title: Russia hits Kyiv with missiles and drones. At least 1 killed and 27 wounded before Ukraine-US talks
Russia launches air attack on Kyiv as Zelenskyy prepares for Trump meeting

items.content: Ukrainian president to meet Canadian PM and call European leaders before travelling to US

items.title: Russia launches 'massive strike' on Kyiv, killing 1 and wounding many ahead of Ukraine-U.S. talks
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one person and wounding 27, a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., authorities said.
items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one person and wounding 27, a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., authorities said.

items.title: Russia pummels Kyiv ahead of Zelensky-Trump meeting
items.standfirst: Russia pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles on Saturday, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelensky's latest talks with US leader Donald Trump. Zelensky said Russia’s attack on Ukraine shows that Russia does “not want to end the war”. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert gives us his analysis.
items.content: Russia pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles on Saturday, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands, ahead of President Volodymyr Zelensky's latest talks with US leader Donald Trump. Zelensky said Russia’s attack on Ukraine shows that Russia does “not want to end the war”. FRANCE 24's Douglas Herbert gives us his analysis.

items.title: Russian drones, missiles pound Ukraine ahead of Zelensky's US visit
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine with missiles and drones on Saturday (December 27), ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelensky said ⁠would be a crucial meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to work out a plan to end nearly four years of war.
items.content: Russia attacked Kyiv and other parts of Ukraine with missiles and drones on Saturday (December 27), ahead of what President Volodymyr Zelensky said ⁠would be a crucial meeting with U.S. President Donald Trump to work out a plan to end nearly four years of war.

items.title: Eye Opener: Zelenskyy and Trump set to meet over peace plan
items.standfirst: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are set to meet this weekend and discuss a potential peace plan. Meanwhile, Russia struck Kyiv overnight, officials said. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
items.content: President Trump and Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy are set to meet this weekend and discuss a potential peace plan. Meanwhile, Russia struck Kyiv overnight, officials said. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.

items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning, killing one and wounding over 20 people a day before talks between Ukraine and the U.S., local authorities said.(Image credit: Efrem Lukatsky)

items.title: Zelenskyy to seek security guarantees from Trump as he heads to talks in Florida

items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is en route to the U.S. via Canada ahead of a weekend of high-stakes diplomacy and a renewed push for peace amid deadly Russian bombing on Ukraine’s capital

items.title: Russia attacks Kyiv ahead of Ukraine-US talks
items.standfirst: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning (December 27), a day before talks between Ukraine and the US, local authorities said.
items.content: Russia attacked Ukraine's capital with missiles and drones early Saturday morning (December 27), a day before talks between Ukraine and the US, local authorities said.

items.title: Live: Zelensky stops in Canada for meeting with PM Carney, ahead of Trump meeting in Florida
items.standfirst: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky arrived in Halifax, Canada, for a meeting with Prime Minister Mark Carney on Saturday, a day ahead of talks with US President Donald Trump in Florida. Russia meanwhile pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.
items.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky arrived in Halifax, Canada, for a meeting with Prime Minister Mark Carney on Saturday, a day ahead of talks with US President Donald Trump in Florida. Russia meanwhile pummelled Ukraine's capital with drones and missiles, killing a woman and cutting power to hundreds of thousands. Follow our liveblog for all the latest updates.

clusters.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
clusters.neutral_headline: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria

items.title: US launches strikes against Islamic State in Nigeria
items.standfirst: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.
items.content: Trump tells Politico he ordered the strikes as "a Christmas present" - contradicting a statement by Nigerian officials.

items.title: Trump says timing of Christmas Day strikes targeting ISIS in Nigeria was intentional
items.standfirst: President Trump said Thursday's strikes on Nigeria targeting ISIS were set for Wednesday but were delayed to Christmas Day for symbolic reasons. Mr. Trump claimed the Nigerian government is failing to protect Christians.
items.content: President Trump said Thursday's strikes on Nigeria targeting ISIS were set for Wednesday but were delayed to Christmas Day for symbolic reasons. Mr. Trump claimed the Nigerian government is failing to protect Christians.

items.title: US air strikes in Nigeria targeted IS group fighters trying to enter from Sahel, govt says
items.standfirst: US-backed air strikes in Nigeria targeted Islamic State group fighters who were attempting to enter the country from the Sahel region, according to the Nigerian government. US President Donald Trump said on his social media platform that the strikes were carried out on Thursday at the request of Nigeria's government, and that the group had been targeting Christians in the region.
items.content: US-backed air strikes in Nigeria targeted Islamic State group fighters who were attempting to enter the country from the Sahel region, according to the Nigerian government. US President Donald Trump said on his social media platform that the strikes were carried out on Thursday at the request of Nigeria's government, and that the group had been targeting Christians in the region.

items.title: U.S. launches surprise Christmas Day strikes on ISIS targets in Nigeria
items.standfirst: The president ordered the strikes on militants he accused of “slaughtering” Christians in Nigeria. Meanwhile, President Trump is expected to host Ukrainian President Zelenskyy for peace talks on Sunday. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin reports.
items.content: The president ordered the strikes on militants he accused of “slaughtering” Christians in Nigeria. Meanwhile, President Trump is expected to host Ukrainian President Zelenskyy for peace talks on Sunday. NBC News’ Julie Tsirkin reports.

items.title: Trump's claim US airstrikes in Nigeria hit ISIS targets 'sketchy', presidential adviser tells Sky News
items.standfirst: A special adviser to the Nigerian president has told Sky News details about who the US hit in Christmas Day strikes in the country were "sketchy" - despite Donald Trump's claims.
items.content: A special adviser to the Nigerian president has told Sky News details about who the US hit in Christmas Day strikes in the country were "sketchy" - despite Donald Trump's claims.

items.title: Trump supporters hail US strikes in Nigeria as ‘amazing Christmas present’
items.standfirst: Some even celebrated ‘mass killing’ and the president’s ‘resolve’ in attacking Islamic State targets The US’s Christmas Day strikes against Islamic State targets in Nigeria have been met with praise by Donald Trump supporters who for months had been agitating for the president to respond forcefully to the killings of Christians in the country.“I can’t think of a better way to celebrate Christmas than by avenging the death of Christians through the justified mass killing of Islamic terrorists,” the far-right political activist Laura Loomer posted on X. “You’ve got to love it! Death to all Islamic terrorists! Thank you.” Continue reading...
items.content: Some even celebrated ‘mass killing’ and the president’s ‘resolve’ in attacking Islamic State targets The US’s Christmas Day strikes against Islamic State targets in Nigeria have been met with praise by Donald Trump supporters who for months had been agitating for the president to respond forcefully to the killings of Christians in the country.“I can’t think of a better way to celebrate Christmas than by avenging the death of Christians through the justified mass killing of Islamic terrorists,” the far-right political activist Laura Loomer posted on X. “You’ve got to love it! Death to all Islamic terrorists! Thank you.” Continue reading...

items.title: U.S. strikes ISIS in Nigeria. And, holiday shopping was higher than expected
items.standfirst: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.
items.content: The U.S. has launched a "deadly strike" against Islamic State fighters in northwest Nigeria, according to Trump. And, holiday spending was higher than expected this year.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)

items.title: Department of Defense video shows a missile being launched after Nigeria strikes
items.standfirst: The United States carried out strikes against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, U.S. President Donald Trump and the U.S. military said.
items.content: The United States carried out strikes against Islamic State militants in northwest Nigeria at the request of Nigeria's government, U.S. President Donald Trump and the U.S. military said.

items.title: U.S. says it struck ISIS in Nigeria after Trump warns of attacks on Christians
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social
items.content: President Donald Trump on Thursday said he ordered “numerous” strikes on Islamic State terrorists in Nigeria he accused of killing Christians.“The United States launched a powerful and deadly strike against ISIS Terrorist Scum in Northwest Nigeria, who have been targeting and viciously killing, primarily, innocent Christians, at levels not seen for many years, and even Centuries!” Trump said in a post on Truth Social

clusters.title: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland slammed across world capitals
clusters.neutral_headline: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland criticized across world capitals

items.title: Israel’s recognition of Somaliland slammed across world capitals
items.standfirst: Regional blocs join nations in condemning Israel's move to formally recognise breakaway Somali region as independent.
items.content: Regional blocs join nations in condemning Israel's move to formally recognise breakaway Somali region as independent.

items.title: Somalia denounces Israeli recognition of Somaliland
items.standfirst: Somalia reacted angrily Friday (December 26) after Israel formally recognised the northern region of Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" – the first country to do so. Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, has for decades pushed for international recognition. US President Donald Trump said he opposed US recognition of Somaliland in an interview with the New York Post.
items.content: Somalia reacted angrily Friday (December 26) after Israel formally recognised the northern region of Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state" – the first country to do so. Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991, has for decades pushed for international recognition. US President Donald Trump said he opposed US recognition of Somaliland in an interview with the New York Post.

items.title: Israel becomes first country to recognise Somaliland as sovereign state
items.standfirst: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...
items.content: Diplomatic breakthrough criticised by African Union, which said it could have ‘far-reaching implications for peace and stability across the continent’Israel has become the first country to recognise Somaliland as a sovereign state, a breakthrough in its quest for international recognition since it declared independence from Somalia 34 years ago.The Israeli foreign minister, Gideon Sa’ar, announced on Friday that Israel and Somaliland had signed an agreement establishing full diplomatic relations, which would include the opening of embassies and the appointment of ambassadors. Continue reading...

items.title: Israel recognises Somaliland as independent state, Netanyahu says
items.standfirst: The decision has been condemned by Somalia, Egypt, Turkey and Djibouti, who call it a dangerous precedent.
items.content: The decision has been condemned by Somalia, Egypt, Turkey and Djibouti, who call it a dangerous precedent.

items.title: African Union and Somalia denounce Israel's recognition of Somaliland
items.standfirst: The African Union and Somalia denounced Israel's announcement on Friday that it viewed Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state". Israel is the first country to recognise Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991.
items.content: The African Union and Somalia denounced Israel's announcement on Friday that it viewed Somaliland as an "independent and sovereign state". Israel is the first country to recognise Somaliland, which declared independence from Somalia in 1991.

items.title: Two killed in stabbing and suspected car-ramming in northern Israel

Continue reading...

clusters.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak sentenced to 15 more years in landmark corruption case
clusters.neutral_headline: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak sentenced to 15 more years in landmark corruption case
items.standfirst: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday (December 26) after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.
items.content: A Malaysian judge sentenced former prime minister Najib Razak to 15 more years in jail on Friday (December 26) after convicting him of abuse of power and money laundering in a sovereign wealth fund graft scandal.

items.title: Former Malaysian PM Najib Razak jailed for 15 more years in 1MDB graft scandal
items.standfirst: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...
items.content: New conviction over plunder of state fund substantially increases six-year term in separate case The jailed former Malaysian prime minister Najib Razak has been sentenced to an additional 15 years after he was found guilty of abuse of power, in the biggest trial yet in the multibillion-dollar fraud scandal related to the state fund 1MDB.Najib’s conviction substantially increases the six-year prison term he is already serving for a separate case related to the 1MDB graft scandal, one of the world’s biggest financial frauds in which billions were plundered from the now defunct sovereign wealth fund. Continue reading...

items.title: Ex-Malaysia PM Najib Razak given 15-year jail term over state funds scandal
items.standfirst: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.
items.content: Najib was convicted for his role in the billion-dollar scandal involving the country's sovereign wealth fund 1MDB.

items.title: Hundreds of Flights Canceled at New York Airports, Even With a Few Inches of Snow
items.standfirst: Kennedy International Airport on Saturday morning. The airport, along with LaGuardia and Newark International, dealt with hundreds of flight cancellations and delays from Friday into Saturday.
items.content: Kennedy International Airport on Saturday morning. The airport, along with LaGuardia and Newark International, dealt with hundreds of flight cancellations and delays from Friday into Saturday.

items.title: Winter weather disrupts air traffic in New Jersey and New York
items.standfirst: Nearly 15,000 flights were canceled or delayed as both states declared weather emergencies after snowstormA mix of snow and ice bore down on the US north-east early on Saturday, disrupting post-holiday weekend airline traffic and prompting officials in New York and New Jersey to issue weather emergency declarations even as the storm ebbed by mid-morning.More than 14,400 domestic US flights on Saturday were canceled or delayed as of mid-morning, with the majority in the New York area, including at John F Kennedy international airport, LaGuardia airport and Newark Liberty international airport, according to the tracking site FlightAware. Continue reading...

items.title: FBI will permanently close the Hoover Building in Washington, Kash Patel says
items.standfirst: The FBI’s J. Edgar Hoover Building in Washington will permanently shut down and the agency will move to different headquarters, according to FBI Director Kash Patel. The switch to the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center would put the bureau in a building currently occupied by the…
items.content: The FBI’s J. Edgar Hoover Building in Washington will permanently shut down and the agency will move to different headquarters, according to FBI Director Kash Patel. The switch to the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center would put the bureau in a building currently occupied by the…

items.title: FBI to move out of brutalist J Edgar Hoover building in Washington DC
items.standfirst: Iconic building, called ‘greatest monstrosity ever constructed’ by Hoover himself, to be closed downThe FBI director, Kash Patel, said the law enforcement agency’s sprawling but ageing J Edgar Hoover building in Washington DC will be closed down and the agency will move into already existing offices elsewhere.Some FBI workers will report to the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center in the US capital to occupy the former offices of the US Agency for International Development, which was controversially dismantled by the Trump administration earlier this year. Continue reading...
items.content: Iconic building, called ‘greatest monstrosity ever constructed’ by Hoover himself, to be closed downThe FBI director, Kash Patel, said the law enforcement agency’s sprawling but ageing J Edgar Hoover building in Washington DC will be closed down and the agency will move into already existing offices elsewhere.Some FBI workers will report to the Ronald Reagan Building and International Trade Center in the US capital to occupy the former offices of the US Agency for International Development, which was controversially dismantled by the Trump administration earlier this year. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Why beef prices are so high right now
clusters.neutral_headline: Why beef prices are so high right now

items.title: Why beef prices are so high right now
items.standfirst: Beef prices are up 15% compared to last year, while chicken and pork prices are only up around 1%. "CBS Saturday Morning" goes behind-the-scenes to figure out what's behind the spike.
items.content: Beef prices are up 15% compared to last year, while chicken and pork prices are only up around 1%. "CBS Saturday Morning" goes behind-the-scenes to figure out what's behind the spike.

clusters.title: Yemen: 'The status quo is no longer feasible', analyst says
clusters.neutral_headline: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions

items.title: Yemen: 'The status quo is no longer feasible', analyst says
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia warned Saturday (December 27) it would back Yemen's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces and urged them to withdraw "peacefully" from recently-seized provinces. The statements came a day after reported Saudi air strikes on separatist positions in Yemen's Hadramawt province. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Liza Kaminov is joined by Mohammed Al-Basha, Founder of Basha Report, a US-based risk advisory firm.
items.content: Saudi Arabia warned Saturday (December 27) it would back Yemen's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces and urged them to withdraw "peacefully" from recently-seized provinces. The statements came a day after reported Saudi air strikes on separatist positions in Yemen's Hadramawt province. For more analysis, FRANCE 24's Liza Kaminov is joined by Mohammed Al-Basha, Founder of Basha Report, a US-based risk advisory firm.

items.title: Saudi Arabia backs Yemen's government, urges separatists to withdraw from seized provinces
items.standfirst: Saudi Arabia on Saturday said it would back Sanaa's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces in a statement that came a day after reported Saudi air strikes in Yemen's Hadramawt province.The Southern Transition Council (STC) separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates have recently made territorial gains, embarrassing regional heavyweight Saudi Arabia.
items.content: Saudi Arabia on Saturday said it would back Sanaa's government in any military confrontation with separatist forces in a statement that came a day after reported Saudi air strikes in Yemen's Hadramawt province.The Southern Transition Council (STC) separatists backed by the United Arab Emirates have recently made territorial gains, embarrassing regional heavyweight Saudi Arabia.

items.title: Yemeni separatists accuse Saudi Arabia of air strikes in eastern provinces
items.standfirst: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday (December 26) accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged.
items.content: Yemen's Southern Transitional Council (STC) separatists on Friday (December 26) accused Saudi Arabia of carrying out air strikes on their positions in the east of the country, a claim Riyadh has not acknowledged.

items.title: Southern separatists in Yemen report Saudi airstrikes near positions
items.standfirst: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...
items.content: Alleged strikes close to UAE-backed forces follow Riyadh’s call for STC to withdraw from newly seized provincesA separatist group in southern Yemen that this month seized two oil-rich provinces has claimed that Saudi Arabia has fired warning airstrikes directed at its forces.Videos issued on Friday by media linked to the United Arab Emirates-backed Southern Transitional Council (STC) showed airstrikes that it said were close to its positions in Wadi Nahab, Hadramaut province. Continue reading...

clusters.title: Family cremates wrong body after hospital mistake
clusters.neutral_headline: Glasgow hospital launches inquiry after wrong body cremated

items.title: Family cremates wrong body after hospital mistake
items.standfirst: The Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow has apologised and launched an investigation.
items.content: The Queen Elizabeth University Hospital in Glasgow has apologised and launched an investigation.

items.title: Glasgow hospital launches inquiry after wrong body cremated
items.standfirst: NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde apologises after error meant one family had no remains at a funeralAn investigation has been launched by a Glasgow hospital after an error led to the wrong body being cremated.The mistaken release of the body by the hospital to the undertakers was only discovered after the funeral service and the cremation had taken place. Continue reading...
items.content: NHS Greater Glasgow and Clyde apologises after error meant one family had no remains at a funeralAn investigation has been launched by a Glasgow hospital after an error led to the wrong body being cremated.The mistaken release of the body by the hospital to the undertakers was only discovered after the funeral service and the cremation had taken place. Continue reading...

clusters.title: UK to offer military 'gap year' to boost recruitment
clusters.neutral_headline: UK youth to be offered military ‘gap year’ in bid to boost defence: Report

items.title: UK to offer military 'gap year' to boost recruitment
items.standfirst: The paid 12-month course is aimed at under-25s, with plans for the scheme to grow to 1,000 young people a year.
items.content: The paid 12-month course is aimed at under-25s, with plans for the scheme to grow to 1,000 young people a year.

items.title: UK youth to be offered military ‘gap year’ in bid to boost defence: Report
items.standfirst: UK plans to boost ranks of armed forces by offering young people paid military experience amid growing Russian threats.
items.content: UK plans to boost ranks of armed forces by offering young people paid military experience amid growing Russian threats.
